title: Want a healthy heart? Turn off the TV and eat a good breakfast

title_detail.value: Want a healthy heart? Turn off the TV and eat a good breakfast

summary: The small lifestyle choices we make each day add up when it comes to heart health. In a new two-pronged study, people who spent less time watching TV and regularly ate an energy-rich breakfast showed significantly less plaque and stiffness in their arteries, indicating a lower chance of developing heart disease or suffering a stroke.
